page.title: 19 Tourism.
page.content: The area has numerous tourist attractions.There are good road communications to the Midlands,South Wales,South West and London. Monmouth is a delightful town which is a convenient centre for exploring the Lower Wye Valley.There are numerous scenic walks along the Monnow and Wye Valley which are excellent for salmon and trout.There is a golf course.The town has many buildings of historical interest which have conservation orders The lower part of Hereford Road contains the North Parade House,which is a fine old Georgian dwelling.Oak House,which now houses the Telephone Exchange,was renovated in 1976 and received a Prince Of Wales Heritage Award. It is perfect for the holidaymaker with a sense of history and appreciation of fine scenery.
